metadata.title: CVE-2021-47143 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:net/smc: remove device from smcd_dev_list after failed device_add()If the device_add() for a smcd_dev fails, there's no cleanup step thatrolls back the earlier list_add(). The device subsequently gets freed,and we end up with a corrupted list.Add some error handling that removes the device from the list.

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-aws package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-azure package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
